mcp_servers.name: example-postgres
mcp_servers.description: PostgreSQL database MCP for querying user data

configuration.notes: Used for fetching user-specific data and history

usage_guidelines.when_to_use: When user asks about their personal data, history, or preferences stored in database
example_queries: SELECT * FROM user_history WHERE user_id = $1 ORDER BY created_at DESC LIMIT 10
usage_guidelines.error_handling: If query fails, inform user that data is temporarily unavailable and suggest retrying

mcp_servers.name: example-firecrawl
mcp_servers.description: Firecrawl MCP for web scraping and content extraction

configuration.notes: Used for extracting content from web pages when user provides URLs

usage_guidelines.when_to_use: When user provides URLs and wants content extracted or when fresh web data is needed
example_usage: Scrape exercise form videos from provided URL
Extract recipe details from cooking website
usage_guidelines.error_handling: If scraping fails, acknowledge limitation and suggest user provide content manually

usage_guidelines.when_to_use: When current information or general knowledge not in training data is needed
usage_guidelines.notes: Use for general knowledge and current information. For user-specific data, use database MCP instead.

tool_priority_order: 1. Check if user-specific data is needed → Use database MCP
2. Check if web content extraction needed → Use Firecrawl MCP
3. Check if current/general information needed → Use web search
4. If no tools needed → Use existing knowledge
notes: Each MCP requires separate configuration in your environment
Tool priority helps agent decide which tool to use when multiple options exist
Document all MCP tools in mcp-docs/ directory for reference
